meanings.definition: Give official permission or approval for (an action)
meanings.sent1: The teacher will sanction the field trip for the students.
meanings.sent2: The city council will sanction the new construction project.
meanings.sent3: The principal decided to sanction an extra recess for the students.
meanings.sent4: The referee will sanction any player who breaks the rules.
meanings.sent5: The king will only sanction the marriage if both families agree.

meanings.definition: A threatened penalty for disobeying a law or rule
meanings.sent1: The school has a sanction for students who cheat on exams.
meanings.sent2: The company faces a sanction for violating environmental regulations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student joked about receiving a sanction for being late.
meanings.sent4: The warning letter served as a sanction for the employee's behavior.
meanings.sent5: The fine was a heavy sanction for parking in the disabled spot.

meanings.sent1: The king's sanction was respected by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The government passed a sanction to protect endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The old law book contained a strange sanction about wearing hats indoors.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scroll revealed a powerful sanction against thieves.
meanings.sent5: The council's sanction was written in bold letters for all to see.

meanings.definition: A coercive measure adopted against a country or individual to enforce international law.
meanings.sent1: The United Nations imposed a sanction on the country for human rights violations.
meanings.sent2: The trade sanction affected the country's economy significantly.
meanings.sent3: The diplomatic sanction was a last resort to prevent war.
meanings.sent4: The international community agreed on a sanction to stop the conflict.
meanings.sent5: The strict sanction was necessary to maintain peace and order.
